page.title: 15TRANSPORT IN KINGS LANGLEY
page.content: {RAIL}_ About 144 trains pass K.Langley daily,linking London with the Midlands and the North. Hourly trains connect with London and Milton Keynes. {ROAD}_ The two main roads carry an excess of heavy industrial traffic, much of which went by rail a generation ago. Buses run to Watford and Hemel Hempstead daily every half_hour except Sundays. The service across the valley to the station is for school_children & commuters, so not at weekends. {THE M25}_ The valley is dominated by the huge supports which will carry the new motorway high above river, canal, railway and roads and intersect with the A41 a mile south of the village.A 42 metre span between the supports will afford some view along the valley. Completion will solve some problems but bring others.
